properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 10 at 4:33AM EST until January 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a

* Flood Watch for a portion of central New York, including the
following areas, Northern and Southern Oneida County.

* From Saturday afternoon through Sunday evening

* A combination of 1 to 2 inches of rainfall and an additional
1 inch of snow melt will lead to significant runoff Saturday
afternoon into Sunday. The runoff may result in minor flooding
of some main stem rivers, along with smaller rivers and
streams. Poor drainage flooding is also possible, especially in
urban areas where snow or ice clog storm drains.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING
